subject: Re: MyClass.class.getResource() problem with JUnit (Eclipse plugin)
msgSnippet: ... call ... , read ; ... That s great job.Congratulate you. I think it s better to post the detail exception stack to help other find the problem more
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "joelwint" <joelwint@...> wrote:
>
> Okay,
>
> At the end, i found out my mistake !! That was coming from the
> security manager (The exception was not given by the getResource
call
> but i found it using an other way). It seems that Eclipse use a
> specific way to launch JUnit Test (through its plugin and a socket
> connection) and Eclipse Junit plugin codebase (defined into java
> policy file) was not allowed to read my config file (retrieved by
> getResource). So i added the following:
>
> grant codeBase "file:/usr/local/eclipse/plugins/-" {
> //For Junit
> permission java.net.SocketPermission "*:1024-",
> "connect,accept,listen,resolve";
> //for my config
> permission java.io.FilePermission "/path/to/my/config/-
", "read";
> };
>
> And now it works...
> Hope it could help others too !
>

That's great job.Congratulate you.
I think it's better to post the detail exception stack to help other
find the problem more easily.:)

Regards.

Yang Gu
